alert.note: Alert for Panola; Quitman; Tallahatchie (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 19 at 12:44AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Panola, Quitman and Tallahatchie. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1244 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charleston, Tutwiler, Marks, Lambert, Crowder, Sumner, Vance, Enid, Waverly, Stover, Brazil, Denton, Longstreet, Mims, Barksdale and Sabino. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
